data.title: Galaxies
data.text:
Shape and structural propertiesHighly flattened disk of stars and gas, containing spiral arms and thickening to a central bulge; Sa and Sba galaxies have largest bulges, the least obvious spiral structure, and roughly spherical stellar halos.

SB galaxies have an elongated central "bar" of stars and gas

No disk Stars smoothly distributed through an ellipsoidal volume ranging from nearly spherical (E0) to very flattened (E7) in shape

No obvious substructure other than a dense central nucleus

No obvious structure; Irr II galaxies often have "explosive" appearance Stellar contentDisks contain both young and old stars; halos consist of old stars onlyContain old stars onlyContain both young and old stars
